column4: you probably have to extract, run ./configure, make, then make install
that's not the best idea if you can use apt-get
you can google for a HOWTO on this subject. Someone's probably written documentation about this.
there wouldn't be - you probably have to compile it
I googled.. and I endup having another problem
what version of Ubuntu do you have?
more googling produced this as well: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=421904
it appears you might have to make a small edit for the VMWare tools to work properly
however I wouldn't try that last link until you tried the first all the way through
if you ask someone else for help, showing them these two links, and saying you followed them, will help your "helper" better understand your situation.
